page.title: 11KENNELL HALL FARM
page.content: Mentioned in the Domesday Book the farm is now a dairy farm of 150 acres and is owned by Mr. & Mrs Will. Morrell who moved there in 1959. There is no record of the present age of the farm as the deeds were thrown into the fire by a previous owner in a fit of temper. It was previously owned by the Strother Family of Westfield House who owned all of Killinghall and much of the land up to{Pateley Bridge.} The farmhouse4 still uses the 11th. Century beams, one oif which is 29feet long. Non of the windows have been stoned-in and are large which probably means it was once owned by royalty, probably{John of Gaunt}who once lived in Knaresborough Castle. It is believed he used it to kennel his hunting dogs hence the farm's name.
